publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1783# Brian Adam: Prescription Charge Exemption for Severe and Enduring Mental Illness—That the Parliament welcomes Mental Health Week in the second week in April; notes the omission of severe and enduring mental illness from the scope of the National Health Service (Charges for Drugs and Appliances) (Scotland) Regulations 1974; expresses concern at the incidence of suicide amongst high-risk groups identified in the Mental Welfare Commission Annual Report 1999-2000, and agrees with the conclusion of the Millan report that essential medication for chronic mental conditions is fundamental to successful care in the community.

S1M-1783# Brian Adam: Prescription Charge Exemption for Severe and Enduring Mental Illness—That the Parliament welcomes Mental Health Week in the second week in April; notes the omission of severe and enduring mental illness from the scope of the National Health Service (Charges for Drugs and Appliances) (Scotland) Regulations 1974; expresses concern at the incidence of suicide amongst high-risk groups identified in the Mental Welfare Commission Annual Report 1999-2000, and agrees with the conclusion of the Millan report that essential medication for chronic mental conditions is fundamental to successful care in the community. Supported by: Fiona McLeod*, Mr Andrew Welsh*
S1M-1783# Prescription Charge Exemption for Severe and Enduring Mental Illness (lodged on 22 March 2001) Tommy Sheridan*, Shona Robison*

S1M-1783# Prescription Charge Exemption for Severe and Enduring Mental Illness (lodged on 22 March 2001) Irene McGugan*, Andrew Wilson*, Alex Neil*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*

Supported by: Fiona McLeod, Mr Andrew Welsh, Tommy Sheridan, Shona Robison, Irene McGugan, Andrew Wilson, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Richard Lochhead, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Nora Radcliffe, Ms Sandra White, Mr Duncan Hamilton*
